means: 限量供应，配给供应( ration的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Staples such as bread, rice and tea are already being rationed.
sentence.Network_cn: 面包、大米和茶叶等日常必需品已实行配给。

sentence.Network_en: Motorists will be rationed to thirty litres of petrol a month.
sentence.Network_cn: 汽车司机每月的油量将限定为30升。

sentence.Network_en: Many basic goods are now rationed. Less and less is available.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多基本商品现在都要定量供给。能买到的东西越来越少。

entry.def: When there is not enough of something, your ration of it is the amount that you are allowed to have.

example.ex: The meat ration was down to one pound per person per week...
example.tran: 肉的配给量降到了每人每周一磅。

example.ex: They have begun to issue ration cards for basic necessities such as rice and flour.
example.tran: 他们开始发行用来购买大米、面粉等生活基本必需品的定量配给卡。

entry.tran: （通常指由于紧缺）配给，定量供应
entry.def: When something is rationed by a person or government, you are only allowed to have a limited amount of it, usually because there is not enough of it.

example.ex: Staples such as bread, rice and tea are already being rationed...
example.tran: 面包、大米和茶叶等日常必需品已实行配给。

entry.def: Rations are the food which is given to people who do not have enough food or to soldiers.

example.ex: Aid officials said that the first emergency food rations of wheat and oil were handed out here last month...
example.tran: 救助官员说第一批紧急援助的小麦和食用油是上月发放到这里的。

example.ex: The Russian soldiers sampled the officers' rations and wolfed the superior food with delight.
example.tran: 俄军士兵尝了一下长官的配给食物，然后高高兴兴地把那些高级食物一扫而光。

entry.def: Your ration of something is the amount of it that you normally have.

example.ex: ...after consuming his ration of junk food and two cigarettes.
example.tran: 他像往常那样吃完垃圾食品、吸了两根烟后

means.word_mean: 1. distributed equitably in limited individual portions;

sentences.sentence: "got along as best we could on rationed meat and sugar"
